content: simple soap saver by laura magdycz this cute and simple soap saver works up quickly and makes a great project for beginner crocheters it functions as an exfoliating washcloth with your bar of soap inside to ensure that you use up that last little sliver of soap materials 25­30 yds of worsted weight cotton yarn size h 5mm crochet hook removable stitch marker tapestry needle terms to know chain ~ chain single_crochet ~ single_crochet sts ~ stitches pattern chain 10 1 starting in second chain from hook single_crochet into the back of each chain across chain 1 turn 9 sts 2 single_crochet into the front loop of each single_crochet across chain 1 turn 3 repeat row 2 4 repeat row 2 5 single_crochet into the back loop of each single_crochet across then single_crochet around the edges of your small rectangle to begin working in the round you should have 9 sts along each of the long edges and 4 sts along each of the short edges 26 sts total you will now be working in one continuous spiral always working in the back loop of the stitch place a removable stitch marker in the first stitch of your round 6 single_crochet into the back loop of each single_crochet for 18 rounds moving your stitch marker up to the first stitch of each new round 7 single_crochet in each of next 6 single_crochet chain 3 skip next 3 single_crochet single_crochet in each of next 10 single_crochet chain 15 skip next 3 single_crochet single_crochet in each of next 4 single_crochet slip_stitch in first single_crochet of next round to join sew in ends to finish
